intro: Dianthus caryophyllus var. collivagus, commonly known as the double carnation, is a cultivar of the carnation species characterized by its dense, layered petals. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is native to the Mediterranean region. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–30 cm, featuring upright stems and clusters of showy, double flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and floral arrangements.
